title: 114_s2264
content: The "Child Tax Credit Improvement Act" is the short title of the Act. It expands the child tax credit. The "Child Tax Credit Improvement Act" expands the child tax credit by increasing the credit amount for young children. The amendment allows a $1,000 credit for qualifying children aged 6 and older, and three times that amount for children under 6. The Child Tax Credit Improvement Act increases the credit amount for young children based on adjusted gross income. The credit is reduced by $150 for each $1,000 by which the taxpayer's income exceeds the threshold amount. The credit allowable under subsection (a)(1) is reduced by $50 for each $1,000 by which the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income exceeds the threshold amount. The credit allowable under subsection (a)(2) is reduced to zero. The term 'modified adjusted gross income' is defined as adjusted gross income increased by any amount excluded from gross income under section 911, 931, or 933. Additionally, the refundable portion of the credit is increased to 45 percent of the taxpayer's earned income. The credit allowable under subsection (a)(2) is reduced to zero. The term 'modified adjusted gross income' is defined as adjusted gross income increased by any amount excluded from gross income under section 911, 931, or 933. Additionally, the refundable portion of the credit is increased to 45 percent of the taxpayer's earned income. Section 32 of the Code is amended to calculate taxable income for the taxable year. Subsection (d) of section 24 is amended by striking paragraph (4). The Internal Revenue Code is amended to eliminate inflation adjustments for certain paragraphs. Additionally, a new subsection is added to adjust the $1,000 amount in subsection (a)(1) for taxable years after 2015 based on the cost-of-living adjustment. The amendments made by this section eliminate inflation adjustments for certain paragraphs and adjust the $1,000 amount in subsection (a)(1) for taxable years after 2015 based on the cost-of-living adjustment. Any increase determined shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $50. The effective date for these amendments is taxable years beginning after December 31, 2015.
